oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Unilateral Nephrectomy for Treatment of Renal Disease in Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Anderson, David E.
Midla, Lowell T.
Desrochers, Andr√©
Rings, D. Michael
Hull, Bruce L.
St-Jean, Guy
Babkine, Marie
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Renal disease
unilateral nephrectomy
survival
productivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Renal disease is occasionally diagnosed in cattle, is usually bilateral and medical therapy the treatment of choice. Nephrectomy may be performed in selected cases where a single kidney primarily is involved. We hypothesized that unilateral nephrectomy can be performed successfully in affected cattle and that these cattle can remain productive members of the herd. The purpose of this retrospective study was to examine medical records of cattle having unilateral nephrectomy and determine survival and productivity in affected cattle.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 298-299
